title: Convert Services pricing into tiered INR packages

requirements.summary: Replace all service price strings in the shared services config with the provided tiered INR package values (keeping service IDs unchanged).
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/config/services.ts, each service's price string matches the new INR value(s) (including the ₹ symbol and ranges where applicable).
No service in the Services/Order UI shows the old $ pricing.

file_operations.description: Update the existing five services' `price` fields to exactly: YouTube Thumbnail — ₹199–299; Instagram Reel Cover — ₹149–199; Logo Design — ₹399–699; Social Media Post — ₹149; Banner Design — ₹299. Keep the existing service IDs unchanged to preserve order prefill and routing.

requirements.summary: Update the Services page heading to 'Our Pricing' and ensure the Services page renders updated INR package pricing while preserving existing Order Now navigation behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/pages/ServicesPage.tsx displays the page title as "Our Pricing" (English).
Each service card on the Services page displays the updated INR price (including ranges where applicable).
The existing per-service "Order Now" CTA continues to navigate to /order with the correct prefilled service selection.

file_operations.description: Change the main H1 heading text from "Our Services" to "Our Pricing". Confirm service cards continue to render `service.price` from the shared services config and that the existing /order navigation with `encodeServicePrefill(service.id)` remains unchanged.

requirements.summary: Ensure all other pricing UI surfaces (Order form service dropdown and Home page service preview) display the updated INR package prices sourced from the shared services config.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/components/order/OrderForm.tsx, the Service Type select items show the updated INR price text for each service.
In frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx, the service preview cards show the updated INR price text for featured services.
All user-facing text remains in English (currency symbol and numeric values as provided).

file_operations.description: Verify the Service Type select item labels render pricing from `services` (e.g., `{service.name} - {service.price}`) with no hardcoded currency, so the updated INR ranges/values appear automatically after the services config update.

Verify the Services Preview section continues to render each featured service's `service.price` from the shared services config (no hardcoded currency), ensuring the updated INR package values display for featured services.
